author: Pete Nakos
title: Caitlin Clark’s greatness, marketability being realized as college career winds down
text: Caitlin Clark's greatness, marketability being realized as college career winds down [Caitlin Clark](https://www.on3.com/db/caitlin-clark-162402/) is one of one. The [Iowa](https://www.on3.com/teams/iowa-hawkeyes/) guard is just 18 points shy of passing Pete Maravich’s all-time scoring record. She is the biggest star in college basketball – male or female. She has played a key role in the popularity of the women’s game, playing in the most-watched game ever for six different TV networks. But beyond the on-court stardom, Clark has set a standard in [NIL](https://www.on3.com/nil/). One of the most marketable names in college sports – right next to [Livvy Dunne](https://www.on3.com/db/livvy-dunne-162353/), [Angel Reese](https://www.on3.com/db/angel-reese-174581/) and [Bronny James ](https://www.on3.com/db/bronny-james-144220/)– has not taken a penny from the Hawkeye-focused NIL collective [Iowa Swarm](https://www.on3.com/nil/collectives/the-swarm-collective-91/). Working with [Excel Sports](https://www.on3.com/nil/news/caitlin-clark-iowa-hawkeyes-basketball-nil-representation-excel-sports-management/), she’s carved notable endorsement partnerships with [Nike](https://www.on3.com/nil/news/nike-basketball-mens-womens-bronny-james-nil-deal-caitlin-clark-haley-jones/), [State Farm](https://www.on3.com/nil/news/caitlin-clark-iowa-hawkeyes-basketball-womens-nil-deal-state-farm-jake-patrick-mahomes/), Hy-Vee and [Gatorade](https://www.on3.com/nil/news/caitlin-clark-iowa-hawkeyes-basketball-nil-deal-gatorade/). On Thursday afternoon, Clark [announced](https://www.on3.com/college/iowa-hawkeyes/news/caitlin-clark-2024-wnba-draft-decision-iowa-hawkeyes-womens-basketball/) this final stretch of the season will be her last at Iowa. The reigning National Player of the Year hopes to lead the Hawkeyes to back-to-back Final Four appearances and their first national title. How do you measure Caitlin Clark’s impact on college sports? But this is it. Caitlin Clark plans to enter the 2024 WNBA draft. Take a minute and enjoy her impact on women’s basketball with the background of an ever-shifting college sports landscape. “She’s changed the landscape of women’s basketball,” said [Michigan](https://thewolverine.com/) head coach Kim Barnes Arico. “She’s incredible. She’s incredible. She’s incredible.” The Big Ten women’s basketball tourney sold out nearly two weeks before the event, making it the first sell-out in league history. She [became](https://www.on3.com/nil/news/caitlin-clark-iowa-hawkeyes-basketball-fanatics-nike-nil-history/) Fanatics’ top-selling college athlete in the NIL Era after she surpassed Kelsey Plum’s scoring title. She passed the previous high seller, [Colorado](https://www.on3.com/college/colorado-buffaloes/) quarterback [Shedeur Sanders](https://www.on3.com/db/shedeur-sanders-107068/nil/). According to Fanatics, more Clark-branded merchandise was sold in less than 24 hours after she broke the record than any other individual men’s or women’s NIL college athlete across all sports has sold since 2022 when NIL merchandise began. Fittingly, one of the top sellers was Nike apparel with the phrase, “You break it, you own it.” An ambassador for the Swoosh, the sneaker and sportswear giant released a graphic with the slogan after Clark broke the NCAA women’s scoring record and then released special merchandise with it. Clark’s success has even had an impact on Iowa athletics. Expense disclosures to the NCAA showed the women’s basketball team brought in over $3.8 million in total revenue in 2022-23, more than double what it had raised in any prior recent year, according to Sportico. Perhaps most telling about her impact, this has all happened in real-time. In the year ahead, Clark, Reese and Sabrina Ionescu will all be credited with helping raise the popularity of women’s basketball and the WNBA. WNBA makes dollars and sense And while fights break on social media about the economics of leaving Iowa for the league, the dollars still add up. Revenue sharing doesn’t exist in college sports yet. Now she will earn a salary from the Indiana Fever, who hold the No. 1 pick in the WNBA draft, while continuing to build off her NIL relationships. Nike and Gatorade are not going to just disappear when she leaves the Hawkeyes. One of the most recognized athletes in the sport, regardless of college or pros, brands will want to align with her name. For the majority of her time as a college athlete, the guard opted to be repped by her uncle, Mike Nizzi. Now working with Alan Zucker, Colleen Garrity and Erin Kane at Excel, she’s surrounded by a team that will ensure her eventual move to the WNBA goes smoothly – on the court and in business. The agency also reps Tiger Woods, Peyton and Eli Manning. With 1.4 million social media followers and a $910,000 [On3 NIL Valuation](https://www.on3.com/db/caitlin-clark-162402/), what Caitlin Clark has accomplished at Iowa will go down in college basketball lore. With most dollars in NIL flowing through collectives and roster value deals, the valuation aims to determine an athlete’s value through NIL and Roster Value. The fact she’s been so successful without taking collective dollars only builds to her case as an NIL savant. Over these next few weeks, take it in. College GameDay is going to Iowa City this weekend. When she scores her 18 points and takes Pistol Pete’s record, she will be the NCAA all-time scorer. So take a minute and enjoy. Watch one more 3-pointer from the Hawkeye logo. Watch the little kids that swarm Carver-Hawkeye Arena for a glimpse at her. And get ready to watch her find similar success – yes, even financially – in the WNBA.

author: @ciudad_magazine
title: Así fue la última charla de Nico Occhiato y Flor Vigna antes de blanquear con Flor Jazmín Peña | Ciudad Magazine
text: Feliz por haber [apostado nuevamente al amor ](https://www.ciudad.com.ar/espectaculos/2024/01/05/nico-occhiato-mostro-la-intimidad-de-su-vida-en-pareja-con-flor-jazmin-pena-y-sorprendio-a-todos/)con Flor Jazmín Peña, Nico Occhiato contó cómo nació esta relación que [superó las barreras de la amistad ](https://www.ciudad.com.ar/espectaculos/2024/01/05/flor-jazmin-pena-aclaro-cual-es-su-verdadero-vinculo-con-nico-occhiato-y-causo-estupor/)y no le esquivó a las preguntas referidas a su ex, Flor Vigna. “Con ella, la mejor, súper bien todo. La verdad es que estoy re contento con cómo le va. El otro día que fue mi cumpleaños me mandó un mensaje y hablamos. [Todo re lindo, la mejor](https://www.ciudad.com.ar/espectaculos/2024/01/03/occhiamin-es-real-y-los-memes-apuntan-a-flor-vigna-una-flor-por-otra-flor/)”, reveló Nico, en una nota que dio a Socios del Espectáculo, dejando en claro que mantiene un buen vínculo con la actual novia de Luciano Castro. En cuanto a su feliz presente con Jazmín Peña, detalló: “Yo estaba soltero y la verdad es que no pensé que me iba a enamorar, y menos de esta forma. Estas cosas pasan [ y es imposible de frenarlo](https://www.ciudad.com.ar/exclusivo/2024/01/02/flor-vigna-rompio-el-silencio-sobre-el-noviazgo-de-nico-occhiato-y-flor-jazmin-pena-son-muy/)”. “Con ella nos conocemos hace cinco años, pero nos pasó hace poco esto de notar que pasaba algo más. Estábamos [ los dos solteros y se dio así](https://www.ciudad.com.ar/espectaculos/2024/01/02/el-sincericidio-de-marcelo-tinelli-luego-de-que-nico-occhiato-blanqueara-su-relacion-con-flor-jazmin-pena/)”, agregó, deslizando que vio con otros ojos a Flor en el último tiempo. Leé más “La exposición la manejamos como podemos. No jode, hay de todo, pero es normal que, al ser dos personas expuestas, lleguen opiniones de todo tipo. Es así y no hay con qué darle”, cerró Occhiato, ante la consulta sobre la [repercusión que tuvo la noticia](https://www.ciudad.com.ar/espectaculos/2024/01/02/revelan-como-se-rompio-la-amistad-entre-flor-vigna-y-flor-jazmin-pena-por-nico-occhiato/). NICO OCCHIATO MOSTRÓ LA INTIMIDAD DE SU VIDA EN PAREJA CON FLOR JAZMÍN PEÑA Nico Occhiato y Flor Jazmín Peña se convirtieron en [una de las parejas del año](https://www.ciudad.com.ar/espectaculos/2024/01/02/nico-occhiato-y-flor-jazmin-pena-confirmaron-su-relacion-al-aire-en-luzu-tv-la-reaccion-de-los-fans/). Después de haber confirmado que comenzaron una nueva historia de amor y que los fanáticos festejaran esta noticia, los jóvenes dejan espiar [un poco de su intimidad](https://www.ciudad.com.ar/espectaculos/2024/01/02/nico-occhiato-y-flor-jazmin-pena-blanquearon-su-noviazgo-con-tremendo-chape-el-video/). En esta oportunidad, [fue Nico quien ](https://www.ciudad.com.ar/espectaculos/2024/01/02/nico-occhiato-revelo-lo-que-siente-por-flor-jazmin-y-le-tiro-un-palazo-a-flor-vigna-nunca/)subió en Instagram Stories un video usando unos anteojos que tiene una cámara incorporada: “Estoy muy pesado con los lentes nuevos y creo que @florjazminpe ya está hinchada los huevos”, fue la frase con la que el actor de Nadie Dice Nada, que se transmite por Luzu TV, tituló su posteo. “¿Vamos? Estoy grabando con mis lentes”, [se lo escuchó decir a Occhiato](https://www.ciudad.com.ar/espectaculos/2024/01/03/los-fans-de-occhiamin-descubrieron-un-detalle-clave-tras-el-beso-de-nico-occhiato-y-flor-jazmin/). Y Flor Jazmín no disimuló su molestia con una divertida cara: “¿Esto va a seguir siendo así mucho tiempo más?”, indagó, fiel a su humor.

author: Dana Becker
title: Expert NCAA Tournament predictions for Iowa State, national champion
text:
Expert NCAA Tournament predictions for Iowa State, national champion
The joy of filling out a bracket is only spoiled by seeing your national champion or Final Four team get knocked out early.
Still, we grab our pen and paper - or phone, tablet or computer - and fill them out as if we know what we are doing.
For those that consider themselves experts, it is always fun to compare or contrast our bracket picks against those.
Here are some of the expert NCAA Tournament picks with what round they have Iowa State losing, who they have cutting down the nets in San Antonio and the Final Four:
NCAA TOURNAMENT EXPERT PICKS FOR IOWA STATE, NATIONAL CHAMPION, FINAL FOUR
Dick Vitale
- Iowa State losing to Michigan State in Sweet 16
- National champion: Duke
- Final Four: Duke, Michigan State, Florida, Houston
Gary Parrish
- Iowa State losing to Ole Miss in second round
- National champion: Auburn
- Final Four: Auburn, St. John’s, Duke, Houston
Matt Norlander
- Iowa State losing in Sweet 16 to Michigan State
- National champion: Houston
- Final Four: Houston, Auburn, St. John’s, Alabama
Kyle Boone
- Iowa State losing to Michigan State in Sweet 16
- National champion: Duke
- Final Four: Duke, Auburn, Texas Tech, Houston
David Cobb
- Iowa State losing to North Carolina in second round
- National champion: Florida
- Final Four: Florida, Michigan State, Duke, Tennessee
Jerry Palm
- Iowa State losing to Michigan State in Sweet 16
- National champion: Florida
- Final Four: Florida, Michigan State, Duke, Houston
Dennis Dodd
- Iowa State losing to Michigan State in Sweet 16
- National champion: Houston
- Final Four: Houston, Michigan State, Florida, Duke
Chip Patterson
- Iowa State losing to North Carolina in second round
- National champion: Duke
- Final Four: Duke, Michigan State, Florida, Tennessee
Cameron Salerno
- National champion: Duke
- Final Four: Duke, Auburn, Florida, Gonzaga
Iowa State losing to North Carolina in second round
Isaac Trotter
- National champion: Duke
- Final Four: Duke, Auburn, Texas Tech, Houston
Iowa State losing to North Carolina in second round
Ryan Fagan
- Iowa State losing to Ole Miss in second round
- National champion: Florida
- Final Four: Florida, Auburn, Duke, Tennessee
Pat Forde
- Iowa State losing to Michigan State in Sweet 16
- National champion: Florida
- Final Four: Florida, Michigan State, Duke, Houston
Bryan Fischer
- Iowa State losing to Ole Miss in second round
- National champion: Florida
- Final Four: Florida, Auburn, Duke, Houston
Jay Bilas
- Iowa State losing to Michigan State in Sweet 16
- National champion: Florida
- Final Four: Florida, Auburn, Duke, Houston
Jeff Borzello
- Iowa State losing to Michigan State in Sweet 16
- National champion: Florida
- Final Four: Florida, Auburn, Duke, Houston

author: 联合早报
title: 中国半导体设备龙头起诉美国竞争对手窃密 | 联合早报
text:
中国半导体设备龙头屹唐半导体起诉了美国竞争对手应用材料窃取机密，并索赔9999万元（人民币，下同，1783万新元），此举标志着中美科技战的进一步升级。
综合观察者网和彭博社报道，屹唐半导体星期三（8月13日）发布公告称，公司因认为应用材料非法获取并使用了公司的等离子体源及晶圆表面处理相关的核心技术秘密，还在中国境内以申请专利的方式披露了技术秘密，且将这项专利申请权据为己有，因此向北京知识产权法院提起诉讼，诉讼金额为9999万元。
屹唐半导体称，利用高浓度、稳定均匀的等离子体进行晶圆表面处理是公司的关键技术之一，相关技术被广泛应用于公司的干法去胶、干法蚀刻、表面处理及改性等半导体加工设备中。公司在该领域具备领先的原创性技术能力，并拥有相关技术秘密。
屹唐半导体也提到，应用材料招聘了曾在屹唐半导体全资子公司Mattson Technology, Inc.（简称MTI公司）工作的两名涉案员工，而他们了解关于等离子体的产生和处理方法的核心技术，熟悉和掌握相关设备结构以及技术工艺。在MTI公司任职期间，这两员工均签署了保密协议，对包括涉案技术秘密在内的技术信息承担严格的保密义务。
屹唐半导体说，证据显示，应用材料招聘这两名员工入职后，向中国国家知识产权局提交了一份发明专利申请，其中主要发明人即为前述两名员工，专利申请披露了屹唐半导体与MTI公司共同所有的涉案技术秘密。
屹唐半导体在公告中指出，被告非法获取和使用原告的技术秘密，并在中国境内以申请专利的方式披露了这项技术秘密，将专利申请权据为己有，违反了《中国反不正当竞争法》的规定，构成侵犯商业秘密的行为，对屹唐半导体的知识产权和经济利益造成严重的损害。
屹唐半导体还说，截至本公告披露日，案件已立案，尚未开庭审理。
《每日经济新闻》以投资者身份致电屹唐半导体，公司董秘办人士说，因为法院刚受理了公司的诉讼请求，开庭审理时间需要等法院进一步通知。对于公司诉讼金额9999万元的确定依据，这名人士说，这是公司对各方面的考虑，包括对公司造成的具体经济损失，另外主要考虑适用三倍的惩罚性赔偿，所以诉讼被告赔偿9999万元。
这名人士也说，签署保密协议都是基本的，员工入职一般都要签。“但如果（这些员工）想要做一些坏事的话，签了保密协议也拦不住他们实际去做。”
晶片设备技术是中美长期科技战的焦点之一。迄今为止，半导体制造设备领域仍由美国、荷兰和日本主导。
多年来，美国主导的行动阻止了中国企业获得荷兰供应商阿斯麦最先进的极紫外光刻系统，这类设备是制造最尖端晶片、用于开发人工智能算法所必需的。如果没有美国设备供应商，包括应用材料和泛林集团的支持，阿斯麦的技术也无法在晶片制造工厂使用。
报道称，虽然屹唐半导体的举动可能被视为中国对美国的一种反击，但两家公司此前就有纠纷。2022年，应用材料曾起诉MTI公司涉嫌企业间谍行为，MTI公司当时否认了所有不当行为指控。
资料显示，屹唐半导体成立于2015年底，主要从事集成电路制造过程中所需晶圆加工设备的研发、生产和销售，面向全球集成电路制造厂商提供包括干法去胶设备、快速热处理设备、干法刻蚀设备在内的集成电路制造设备及配套工艺解决方案。公司于今年7月8日在上交所科创板上市。
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance
Economy, Business and Finance->financial and economic news

author: ESPN.com.br
title: Arias vai ficar no Flu? Jogador se irrita com perguntas sobre futuro: 'Chega disso'
text:
Decisivo na
[vitória por 1 a 0 sobre o Palmeiras, nesta quarta-feira (24), no Maracanã](/futebol/brasileirao/artigo/_/id/13948614/fluminense-vence-palmeiras-arias-decide-forma-emocionante-confirma-reacao-brasileirao), Jhon Arias se irritou com as perguntas sobre o seu futuro. E pediu um basta.
Destaque com a
[Colômbia](/futebol/time/_/id/208/colombia) na última [Copa América](/futebol/liga/_/nome/conmebol.america), Arias vem tendo o seu nome citado em diversas especulações no mercado da bola. Mas não escondeu a irritação com as frequentes perguntas de jornalistas sobre uma possível saída do Tricolor das Laranjeiras.
O jogador de 26 anos possui contrato com os cariocas até o fim de junho de 2026, ou seja, pouco menos de dois anos.
"Fica no Fluminense?", perguntou um dos repórteres presentes na zona mista no Maracanã.
"Não posso ficar respondendo a mesma coisa em toda entrevista, coletiva. Sempre a mesma pergunta, chega disso", disparou o colombiano.
Ainda durante a entrevista, Arias destacou a importância da torcida para que o Fluminense possa sair dessa desconfortável situação no Z-4 da tabela do
[Brasileirão](/futebol/liga/_/nome/bra.1). E ainda falou sobre o seu retorno ao time após o tempo ausente por conta da Copa América.
"Desde que voltei eu falei isso, falei que eu vinha com essa responsabilidade de ajudar o time a sair dessa situação que, infelizmente, a gente está vivendo, mas acho que, aos poucos, passo a passo, estamos conseguindo nos reencontrar, conseguindo voltar a vencer e acho que hoje foi um exemplo disso. O torcedor veio em massa, veio apoiar a gente, apoiou a gente desde o primeiro momento. Eu acho que isso é importante para nós. Vamos precisar muito disso, porque, como disse e tenho dito, acho que é o momento de ir todo mundo junto para salvar o Fluminense dessa situação que está passando", concluiu.
Esta foi a segunda partida de Jhon Arias desde que retornou dos Estados Unidos. Na temporada, o camisa 21 disputou 27 jogos, anotou 7 gols e contribuiu com 5 assistências.
Próximos jogos do Fluminense:
[Red Bull Bragantino](/futebol/time/_/id/6079/red-bull-bragantino)(F) - 28/07, 11h (de Brasília) - [Brasileirão](/futebol/liga/_/nome/bra.1/brasileiro) [Juventude](/futebol/time/_/id/6270/juventude)(F) - 01/08, 19h (de Brasília) - [Copa do Brasil](/futebol/liga/_/nome/bra.copa_do_brazil) [Bahia](/futebol/time/_/id/9967/bahia)(C) - 04/08, 16h (de Brasília) - [Brasileirão](/futebol/liga/_/nome/bra.1/brasileiro)

author: Shaun Cichacki
title: How to Use Divine Blessing in Monster Hunter World (MHW) - Prima Games
text: Any skill that can save you some HP when you’re in a challenging battle is worth your time, but how do you activate the Divine Blessing in Monster Hunter: World? Is it a game of chance, or something that requires a specific skill to nail every time? How To Activate Divine Blessing in Monster Hunter: World If you have Divine Blessing equipped, you don’t need to worry about hitting a button at the perfect moment, or anything like that. This isn’t Dark Souls, even if it feels like it sometimes. Divine Blessing has anywhere from a 25% to 40% chance of activating, depending on how many pieces of equipment have been blessed with this particular buff. The armor you create, especially at later levels, can be bestowed with the Divine Blessing perk. The more armor you wear with this particular perk, the more damage you may be able to absorb. You’ll find the amount of damage that you can withstand if Divine Blessing activates as follows: - 1 Equipment Piece – 15% Less Damage, 25% Chance to Activate - 2 Equipment Pieces – 30% Less Damage, 25% Chance to Activate - 3 Equipment Pieces – 50% Less Damage, 25% Chance to Activate - 4 Equipment Pieces – 60% Less Damage, 25% Chance to Activate - 5 Equipment Pieces – 60% Less Damage, 40% Chance to Activate So, while it’s a game of chance, it’s a surprisingly good chance to help you withstand some major damage. It can literally save your life, and doesn’t require any sort of button prompt, so hope that luck can take your side and lead you to the ultimate victory. Need some help ensuring that you’re getting the most out of Monster Hunter: World experience, or just want to find out if the game [received a PS5/Xbox Series patch? ](https://primagames.com/tips/does-monster-hunter-world-have-an-xbox-series-x-ps5-patch-answered)Be sure to check out our Monster Hunter: World section below to learn more about this exciting action adventure.

author: KEN LANE, Special to the Courier
title: The Mountain Gardener: Autumn's encore — Orchestrating a spectacular fall garden
text:
While spring gardens charm with their fresh blooms and summer gardens dazzle with their vibrant colors, the autumn garden offers a truly spectacular finale. With the right plants, your garden can put on a showstopping performance as the days grow shorter and the air turns crisp. Let’s explore how to create an excellent autumn garden that will leave you and your friends captivated.
Extending the bloom season

author: Bulawayo24 News
title: Machacha questions Blessed Geza's liberation credentials
text:
News / National
Machacha questions Blessed Geza's liberation credentials
37 secs ago | Views
Zanu PF national political commissar Munyaradzi Machacha has launched a scathing attack on war veterans leader Blessed Geza, casting serious doubt on his liberation struggle credentials and personal integrity. The broadside follows Geza's recent scathing criticism of President Emmerson Mnangagwa's leadership and a stayaway action spearheaded by disgruntled war veterans.
Geza, popularly known as "Bombshell", recently made headlines after accusing President Mnangagwa of running a corrupt and failed regime, urging him to step down. His remarks triggered swift condemnation from the ruling party's top leadership - with Machacha, who revealed a familial link to Geza, taking centre stage in discrediting his uncle's past.
In a sharply worded statement, Machacha dismissed Geza's liberation war contributions, claiming he was "never at the war front" during his time in Chimoio, Mozambique. Instead, he alleged, Geza focused on looting fellow combatants' clothing to barter for food, alcohol, and cigarettes.
"His activities in Chimoio were far from heroic," said Machacha. "He was notorious for stealing uniforms and misusing resources meant for the liberation effort."
According to Machacha, Geza was later sent to Romania for artillery training but quickly abandoned his mission, falsely claiming to be the son of the late former president Robert Mugabe. Geza reportedly exploited a family connection - his brother's marriage to Mugabe's sister, Dr Regina Ntombi Gata - to secure VVIP privileges while avoiding military instruction.
"Instead of undergoing the rigorous training he was sent for, he lounged in luxury, feeding off a lie," Machacha said.
He further alleged that after independence, Geza continued to display dubious behaviour, frequently demanding promotions in the army and engaging in opportunistic activities. During the Mozambican conflict in the 1980s, Geza reportedly got Frelimo soldiers drunk and stole spare parts from their vehicles to sell back home.
Machacha also accused Geza of exploiting the land reform programme for personal gain, raiding white-owned farms and seizing property under the guise of empowerment.
The blistering attack from Machacha appears to be part of a broader effort by the ruling party to neutralise internal dissent and delegitimise voices challenging Mnangagwa's authority, especially among the liberation war veterans - a group traditionally viewed as Zanu PF's core support base.
Geza has yet to publicly respond to the allegations. However, sources close to the war veterans' leadership say the attacks are unlikely to silence him or stop growing discontent within the ranks of former fighters over poor living conditions and allegations of high-level corruption in government.
Geza, popularly known as "Bombshell", recently made headlines after accusing President Mnangagwa of running a corrupt and failed regime, urging him to step down. His remarks triggered swift condemnation from the ruling party's top leadership - with Machacha, who revealed a familial link to Geza, taking centre stage in discrediting his uncle's past.
In a sharply worded statement, Machacha dismissed Geza's liberation war contributions, claiming he was "never at the war front" during his time in Chimoio, Mozambique. Instead, he alleged, Geza focused on looting fellow combatants' clothing to barter for food, alcohol, and cigarettes.
"His activities in Chimoio were far from heroic," said Machacha. "He was notorious for stealing uniforms and misusing resources meant for the liberation effort."
According to Machacha, Geza was later sent to Romania for artillery training but quickly abandoned his mission, falsely claiming to be the son of the late former president Robert Mugabe. Geza reportedly exploited a family connection - his brother's marriage to Mugabe's sister, Dr Regina Ntombi Gata - to secure VVIP privileges while avoiding military instruction.
"Instead of undergoing the rigorous training he was sent for, he lounged in luxury, feeding off a lie," Machacha said.
He further alleged that after independence, Geza continued to display dubious behaviour, frequently demanding promotions in the army and engaging in opportunistic activities. During the Mozambican conflict in the 1980s, Geza reportedly got Frelimo soldiers drunk and stole spare parts from their vehicles to sell back home.
Machacha also accused Geza of exploiting the land reform programme for personal gain, raiding white-owned farms and seizing property under the guise of empowerment.
The blistering attack from Machacha appears to be part of a broader effort by the ruling party to neutralise internal dissent and delegitimise voices challenging Mnangagwa's authority, especially among the liberation war veterans - a group traditionally viewed as Zanu PF's core support base.
Geza has yet to publicly respond to the allegations. However, sources close to the war veterans' leadership say the attacks are unlikely to silence him or stop growing discontent within the ranks of former fighters over poor living conditions and allegations of high-level corruption in government.
Source - online

author: yolande.
title: I lavoratori di Amazon pianificano proteste globali durante il fine settimana dello shopping del Black Friday per il quinto anno consecutivo
text:
-
I lavoratori di Amazon in più di 20 paesi protesteranno tra il Black Friday e il Cyber Monday.
-
È il quinto anno che i lavoratori di Amazon protestano durante il principale fine settimana di shopping.
-
L'azienda ha minimizzato le azioni, adottando separatamente alcune misure per soddisfare le richieste dei lavoratori.
I lavoratori di più di 20 paesi, compresi gli Stati Uniti, sono pronti a protestare o a scioperare tra il Black Friday e il Cyber Monday sui salari, sulle condizioni di lavoro e sull’impatto ambientale di Amazon.
Le proteste fanno parte della quinta campagna annuale Make Amazon Pay, organizzata da una coalizione di organizzazioni sindacali e progressiste.
A Nuova Delhi, dove i dipendenti hanno affermato che Amazon li ha tenuti a lavorare durante l’ondata di caldo di questa primavera, i lavoratori hanno intenzione di marciare contro il Parlamento chiedendo salari più alti e tutele del lavoro. I lavoratori di diversi magazzini tedeschi sono destinati a lasciare il lavoro.
A New York City, i lavoratori affiliati alla Retail, Wholesale, and Department Store Union stanno marciando verso l’attico del fondatore di Amazon Jeff Bezos.
Le proteste hanno funzionato?
Sì e no.
Amazon ha minimizzato le proteste, definendole su piccola scala e affermando che i gruppi di lavoro che organizzano Make Amazon Pay stanno presentando un ritratto fuorviante e negativo del lavoro in azienda.
“Il fatto è che in Amazon forniamo ottimi stipendi, grandi benefici e grandi opportunità, tutto fin dal primo giorno”, ha detto in una nota la portavoce Eileen Hards. “Abbiamo creato più di 1,5 milioni di posti di lavoro in tutto il mondo, e ce ne saranno ancora, e forniamo un ambiente di lavoro moderno, sicuro e coinvolgente, sia che lavoriate in un ufficio o in uno dei nostri edifici operativi.”
Separatamente, ha anche adottato misure che rispondono ad alcune delle richieste dei manifestanti, anche se non tutti i lavoratori dicono di essere soddisfatti del ritmo di progresso dell’azienda.
Mentre i gruppi di lavoro si fanno strada nella rete logistica statunitense di Amazon, l’azienda ha aumentato i salari e ha diffuso il suo impegno per la sicurezza.
Nell'ultimo anno, la Teamsters Union ha ottenuto diverse vittorie organizzative nelle operazioni logistiche americane di Amazon. L’Amazon Labour Union, che rappresenta circa 5.500 lavoratori in un magazzino di Staten Island, ha votato a giugno per affiliarsi ai Teamsters. Anche gli autisti delle consegne e gli operatori degli hub aerei in California, Kentucky e Atlanta si sono uniti ai Teamsters.
A settembre, Amazon ha aumentato i salari dei magazzinieri e dei trasporti a una media di 22 dollari l’ora. In un post sul suo sito web, la società non ha citato l’attivismo sindacale come motivo degli aumenti, affermando che erano “parte di un processo annuale in cui rivediamo i nostri salari e benefici per garantire che rimangano competitivi”.
Che dire dell’impronta climatica di Amazon?
Quest’estate, Amazon ha anche annunciato di aver raggiunto un ambizioso obiettivo climatico, ovvero “equiparare” l’elettricità consumata dalle sue operazioni globali con energia rinnovabile, riducendo al contempo la propria impronta di carbonio del 3% rispetto all’anno precedente.
L’azienda ha dichiarato di aver raggiunto l’obiettivo sette anni prima del previsto, in parte diventando il più grande acquirente aziendale di energia rinnovabile al mondo.
I membri di Amazon Employees for Climate Justice, un gruppo organizzativo composto in gran parte da lavoratori aziendali, hanno affermato che i calcoli dell’azienda non includono le emissioni di commercianti terzi, che rappresentano più della metà delle vendite sul negozio online di Amazon. Amazon ha contestato i risultati del gruppo.
Amazon si è concentrata su “tutti i progetti a portata di mano che poteva. Ma ora sono tutti fatti, e quello che stiamo vedendo è che non stanno facendo le cose difficili”, Eliza Pan, ex dipendente di Amazon e membro del gruppo climatico, ha detto al Seattle Times a luglio.
Hards, il portavoce di Amazon, ha affermato che Amazon non ha ancora finito di ridurre la propria impronta di carbonio.
“Alcune azioni comporteranno un risparmio immediato di carbonio, mentre altre richiederanno anni per dimostrare i risultati – e continueremo a investire in soluzioni sia comprovate che nuove supportate dalla scienza per aiutare a risolvere questa crisi”, ha affermato Hards.
Cosa significano le proteste per lo shopping del Black Friday?
Non si sono verificati ritardi significativi a seguito delle proteste Make Amazon Pay negli anni precedenti e sembra improbabile che quest'anno avranno un impatto sui tempi di spedizione.
Le festività natalizie rappresentano un driver di entrate significativo per il gigante della vendita al dettaglio online. Amazon ha registrato vendite natalizie “da record” negli ultimi tre mesi del 2023. Lo ha detto il CEO di Amazon Andy Jassy in una conferenza sugli utili all’inizio di quest’anno. La società ha registrato un fatturato di 170 miliardi di dollari in quel trimestre, in aumento del 14% rispetto all’anno precedente.
Leggi l'articolo originale su Business Insider
